alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 06 at 6:04AM MDT until May 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR MOST OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SUNDAY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHERN AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Additional rounds of strong southwest winds, low humidity, seasonably warm temperatures, and an unstable airmass will lead to critical fire weather conditions below snowpack through the weekend. Widespread critical fire weather is expected today over all but portions of northwestern New Mexico. Critical conditions will then focus toward the eastern half of the region Sunday. Critical conditions may persist into the middle of next week. In addition, lightning strikes from earlier this week may lead to new ignitions in receptive fuels. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), East Central Plains (Zone 126), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), and Northeast Plains (104) today from noon to 8 pm and again on Sunday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph today and Sunday with winds speeds peaking in the afternoon hours. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent Saturday afternoon and Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
